Sentencas: A BaZrO3-based electrolyte with low Pr-doping concentration is proposed as electrolyte for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Proton conducting solid oxide fuel cells with chemically stable BaZr0.75Y0.2Pr0.05O3-δ electrolyte

Sentencas: The new material BaZr0.75Y0.2Pr0.05O3-delta (BZYP5) shows a good chemical stability against CO2.
Titulo: Proton conducting solid oxide fuel cells with chemically stable BaZr0.75Y0.2Pr0.05O3-δ electrolyte

Sentencas: In addition, the low doping concentration of Pr in BaZrO3 improves the sinterability of BaZrO3 and also allows its structure to remain stable even in the reducing atmosphere, which is critical for fuel cell applications.
Titulo: Proton conducting solid oxide fuel cells with chemically stable BaZr0.75Y0.2Pr0.05O3-δ electrolyte

Sentencas: The cell with BZYP5 as electrolyte shows maximum power densities of 124, 70, and 43 mW cm(-2) at 600, 550, and 500 degrees C, respectively, which are larger than that for the cell with conventional high Pr-doping BaZrO3 electrolyte reported previously.
Titulo: Proton conducting solid oxide fuel cells with chemically stable BaZr0.75Y0.2Pr0.05O3-δ electrolyte

Sentencas: Electrochemical analysis indicates that the BZYP5 electrolyte shows a good ionic conductivity.
Titulo: Proton conducting solid oxide fuel cells with chemically stable BaZr0.75Y0.2Pr0.05O3-δ electrolyte

Sentencas: These results suggest that the low Pr-doping strategy presented in this study promotes the densification for BaZrO3 and the good electrolyte conductivity of BaZrO3 is maintained which could be the reason for the improved cell performance, suggesting BZYP5 is a promising electrolyte for proton-conducting SOFCs.
Titulo: Proton conducting solid oxide fuel cells with chemically stable BaZr0.75Y0.2Pr0.05O3-δ electrolyte
